Description: Sherd of rim and wall of East Greek pottery lid, or more likely pedestal; regularly set holes pierced through rim before firing; white slip on outside; worn orange glaze; two bands on outside of rim, at least one on upper surface.
Curator's comments: The angle of the wall is probably too steep for this to be a lid; it is substantiall taller than the two related pieces with drilled rims, 1965,0930.520 and 521.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.755)
